Posts.Content: magret wrote: Hey ladies - so glad I found this site.  I have been lurking for a while, But now I finally decided to post because I plan on calling my doctor (GP, not a GYN) tomorrow and asking the questions I should have asked last week.  Two weeks ago I had my annual mammogram, a week later was called back for additional films.  As soon as the additional films were taken, I was immediately taken over for an ultrasound.  That led to a second (larger area was covered) ultrasound.  Two days later I got a call from my doctor's nurse saying the radiologist report said 'abnormalities not clearly visible' and that I 'had 3 options; 1-MRI, 2-further studies, 3-consult w/ surgeon'.   I asked what would a consult w/ a surgeon result in?  she said that he would review the films, do an exam and either schedule a MRI or a biopsy.  So I figured skip to the MRI.  So a week after the 2nd mammogram/ultrasound I had an MRI (right breast only).  Two days later my doc's nurse called again and said 'no signs of malignancy'.  that's it.  nothing more.  I was so glad to hear that, I didn't ask anything just said ok and hung up.  So...  I plan on calling my doc tomorrow to ask; 1-so what is the 'abnormality'?  2-what's next?  6 month follow-up mammo?  or wait for my annual? Is there anything else I should ask?  I feel like I should have been given more information.  Would the mammogram/ultrasound have had a BI-RAD score?  They didn't offer one, but I didn't know enough at that point to ask.  Anything you can offer is much appreciated!  While I was initially very relieved to get the call about the MRI results, I now feel a bit concerned that I should have more information about what is going on.  thanks!  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: newbie - not malignant, but what is it? magret SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2011 12:30PM magret wrote: Thank you so much Beesie.  I left a message with my doc's office this morning and they just called me back.  The nurse said the doc was very reassured that it is a benign cyst, but it is entirely up to me if i would like to see a breast surgeon to be reassured.  She is calling to schedule an appt for me now.  :)   I forgot to mention in my post that last week I found out that my mother had taken DES while pregnant with me (and all my siblings) so knowing that only added to my anxiety. Again - thank you so much!  Without your nudge, I might have just waited for til my annual exam (12 months!) and driven myself (and everyone else) crazy.
Posts.Title: newbie - not malignant, but what is it? magret SarahsMom
